item.title: Bowery Farming is ceasing operations
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description:
Agtech unicorn Bowery Farming is shutting down, according to PitchBook, which cited internal documents and multiple company employees. The New York-based agtech company was known for building vertical farms that could produce crops including: lettuces, herbs, and berries. The company has raised more than $700 million in funding, according to PitchBook data, from VCs including […]

item.title: Apple users can soon upgrade to ChatGPT Plus within the Settings app
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
Apple products are getting an integration with OpenAI’s ChatGPT in December when iOS 18.2 rolls out, which should supercharge Siri and a few other features with smarter AI. On Monday, iOS 18.2 beta testers got a taste of how OpenAI could profit off of its Apple partnership. Apple is including an option to upgrade to […]

item.title: Perplexity CEO offers AI company’s services to replace striking NYT staff
item.dc:creator: Devin Coldewey
item.description:
The CEO of AI search company Perplexity, Aravind Srinivas, has offered to cross picket lines and provide services to mitigate the effect of a strike by New York Times tech workers. The NYT Tech Guild announced its strike Monday, after setting November 4 as its deadline months earlier. The workers represented provide software support and […]

item.title: Bluesky gears up for Election Day as X goes pro-Trump
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
As Election Day in the U.S. nears, social networking startup Bluesky, now flush with new capital, hopes to demonstrate that its platform can serve as a more trusted, fact-checked alternative to Elon Musk’s X. While the latter is dominated by Musk’s support for the Trump campaign, Bluesky tends to lean left, thanks to its influx […]

item.title: Amazon brings generative AI-powered recaps to Prime Video
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description:
Instead of scouring the internet for a summary of a TV show, which often risks unintentionally revealing major plot points, Prime Video’s latest feature aims to save viewers from encountering any spoilers. Amazon announced on Monday the launch of “X-Ray Recaps,” a generative AI-powered feature that creates concise summaries of entire seasons, single episodes, and […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Amazon acknowledges screen issues on a ‘small number’ of Kindle Colorsoft units
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
After more than a decade of waiting, Amazon’s first color Kindle has stumbled out of the gate. An issue with the new display has left Colorsoft buyers leaving unfavorable reviews. At last count, the e-reader is hovering around 2.7 stars. The company confirmed the display issues that are affecting a “small number” of units in […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Regulators deliver successive blows to Amazon and Meta’s nuclear power ambitions
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description:
A series of recent rulings from regulators dashed the Big Tech companies' hopes of finding a quick fix for their electricity needs.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: From Lime to Uber to Hertz: Free and discounted Election Day rides
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
Election Day is nearly here, and if you haven’t already mailed in your ballot or gone in for early voting, you might need a ride come November 5.  Here’s a roundup of all the freebies, discounts, and information on getting to the polls that transportation companies are offering. Micromobility Lime is offering free rides to […]

item.title: Anthropic hikes the price of its Haiku model
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Anthropic’s newest AI model has arrived. But it’s pricier than the last generation, and unlike Anthropic’s other models, it can’t analyze images just yet. Claude 3.5 Haiku, which Anthropic announced last month, matches or bests the performance of Anthropic’s flagship model, Claude 3 Opus, on specific benchmarks. Available through Anthropic’s API and a number of […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: The brightest bling of TechCrunch Disrupt 2024
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling, Sarah Perez
item.description:
At TechCrunch Disrupt, our team sits front and center, furiously typing away at our laptops to publish real-time news from impressive speakers like NFL quarterback-turned-founder Colin Kaepernick, Perplexity AI founder Aravind Srinivas, and Ashton Kutcher. We are a well-oiled machine. Some writers have been covering Disrupt since the old days, before Meta was Meta and […]

item.title: Anduril is considering Arizona, Ohio, or Texas for its massive manufacturing facility, source says
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description:
Anduril, the defense tech company co-founded by Palmer Luckey, is considering building its first major manufacturing plant, a 5-million-square-foot facility known as “Arsenal-1,” in Arizona, Ohio, or Texas, according to someone familiar with the matter.  The company, which is developing autonomous drones, planes, and submarines, had announced $1.5 billion at a $14 billion post-money valuation […]

item.title: Meta says it’s making its Llama models available for US national security applications
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
To combat the perception that its “open” AI is aiding foreign adversaries, Meta today said that it’s making its Llama series of AI models available to U.S. government agencies and contractors in national security. “We are pleased to confirm that we’re making Llama available to U.S. government agencies, including those that are working on defense […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: DeepRoute raises $100M in push to beat Tesla’s FSD in China
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
DeepRoute.ai, a Shenzhen-based autonomous driving technology startup, raised $100 million from an unidentified Chinese automaker. The company aims to get its automated driving systems into as many vehicles in China before Tesla takes off next year, according to a Reuters report. China lifted certain restrictions on Tesla vehicles in April, clearing a path for the […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Built in four days, this $120 robot arm cleans a spill with help from GPT-4o
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
Large language models have already proven transformative for robotics. While researchers and companies alike utilize the platforms to supercharge robotic learning, a pair of roboticists at UC Berkeley and ETH Zurich challenged themselves by leveraging generative AI to put a cheap robot arm to work. Jannik Grothusen and Kaspar Janssen trained a pair of $120 […]

item.title: Columbus says ransomware gang stole personal data of 500,000 Ohio residents
item.dc:creator: Carly Page
item.description:
Columbus says hackers accessed resident's Social Security numbers and bank account details

item.title: No, startups shouldn’t always take the highest valuation, seed VCs say
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description:
One of the lessons that the wild Silicon Valley venture funding environment of the past few years has clearly taught is this: Bigger valuations are not always better. “I think we’ve all kind of seen the negative impact of having a valuation too high from the last, call it, three years,” Elizabeth Yin, co-founder of […]

item.title: ChatGPT Search is not OpenAI’s ‘Google killer’ yet
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
OpenAI's search offers a glimpse of what an AI-search interface could one day look like. But it's too impractical as a daily driver right now.

item.title: US laws regulating AI prove elusive, but there may be hope
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Can the U.S. meaningfully regulate AI? It’s not at all clear yet. Policymakers have achieved progress in recent months, but they’ve also had setbacks, illustrating the challenging nature of laws imposing guardrails on the technology. In March, Tennessee became the first state to protect voice artists from unauthorized AI cloning. This summer, Colorado adopted a tiered, risk-based […]

item.title: Vanguard cuts Indian rideshare startup Ola’s valuation to $2B
item.dc:creator: Manish Singh
item.description:
Vanguard has revised its valuation of Indian ride-hailing startup Ola to about $2 billion as of the end of August.

item.title: Threads now has 275M monthly active users
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
Meta's social network, Threads, now has 275 million monthly active users, the company said on Sunday.
